rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The language states a number of cases factually.
The segment reports cases 'have been confirmed' (plain verb) paired with scale ('More than 100 cases'), which does not trigger Q3.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports the number of cases without explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
States number of cases, not capability or preparedness.
Reports 'More than 100 cases have been confirmed', factually reporting a numerical metric.
